Description: Thirty-nine trees were selectively cut in a Quercus myrsinaefolia coppice forest (Shimoyamasa, Hirose cho, Shimane Prefecture, Japan) in November 1980.  Prior to this selective cut, the forest was selectively cut in 1959, 1962, 1966, 1969 (Yasue and Fujie 1970). By the first selective cut in 1959, the forest was made into nearly pure stand of Quercus myrsinaefolia. Within 39 felled trees, 33 sample trees were treated with the stratified clip technique by cutting them at the interval of 0.8 m and stem discs were collected. Branches and leaves were separated from stem in each 0.74 m layer and weighted for the fresh mass.

Measured fresh mass of each component (stem, branch, and leaves) was converted to dry mass from the ratio of dry to fresh mass. The ratio was estimated from subsamples taken. For stem, discs were used for subsamples. Subsamples were oven-dried at 105 degC for 72 h. For leaves, 1.88, 1.42, and 0.47 kg of leaves were collected as subsample from the upper, middle, and lower layers. The ratio was 0.50-0.59 for stem, 0.528 for branch, and 0.388 for leaves.

M. Ishihara, H. Utsugi, H. Tanouchi, and T. Hiura conducted formal search of reference databases and digitized raw data from Yasui et al. (1983). Based on this reference, meta data was also created by M. Ishihara. Species name and family names were converted by M. Ishihara according to the following references: Satake Y, Hara H (1989a) Wild flower of Japan Woody plants I (in Japanese). Heibonsha, Tokyo; Satake Y, Hara H (1989b) Wild flower of Japan Woody plants II (in Japanese). Heibonsha, Tokyo.
